AUDT.title: Other
AUDT.helpText:
Note: If you select 'Compare texts' it is assumed that the texts will be contained in a document already uploaded to KaplanGPT.

Note: The purpose of the 'Teaching plan' prompt is to help produce a course guide by taking an existing course guide and identifying the following to be incorporated:
- Functional skills
- British values
- KSBs
- Real-world examples
- Progression / employability / personal development

AUDT.title: Would you like to reference British Values as part of your prompt?
Do you want to use a taxonomy for the subject matter,  something custom or an existing document upload?
AUDT.helpText:
You have 3 options for the subject matter on which to base your video script:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options. 

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "custom" option and type in your desired subject matter.

3/ Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

AUDT.title: Do you want to use a taxonomy for this subject,  something custom or an existing document upload?
Are you going to input some original text or use an existing document upload?
AUDT.helpText:
You can use the "original text" option in order to submit the existing question and answer on which to base the new question(s) you're creating.

Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

AUDT.title: Subject matter
AUDT.helpText:
You should input the subject matter for your prompt by answering the question below.

Note: If you are "doing your own thing" rather than following a specific prompt, please type your desired prompt here.

AUDT.title: Would you like to use all the uploaded document, or just part?
Which part?
AUDT.helpText:
Please identify the specific part of the uploaded document which you wish to use. (avoid using page numbers) Examples:

- Test your understanding 2
- Illustration 9
- Question 33 and Answer 33
- Chapter 12 Deferred taxation
- Chapter 11 Hedge accounting, S4.2 Criteria for hedge accounting

AUDT.title: Number of questions
AUDT.helpText:
Please indicate the number of OT questions you would like to create.  As a general rule, it is better to ask for more than you need.  For example, if you want ten good questions, ask for fifteen and filter out the ones you are not as happy with.

This can be written or numerical, i.e. 10 or ten.

AUDT.title: KSBs / British values / Functional skills
AUDT.helpText: Here you can decide which, if any, of the KSBs / British values / Functional skills you want to have referenced in the feedback to the OTQs you are creating.

AUDT.title: Which of the following would you like to include (select all that apply - or none)
What type of question do you want to create?
AUDT.helpText: Please choose the type of objective test question you would like to create. If you do not see your question type listed in the options, you can choose "other question type" and be guided to then input the type of question you want to create.

AUDT.title: Fill in the gaps
AUDT.helpText: How many gaps would you like to be included in your 'fill in the gaps' style question?

AUDT.title: Other question type
AUDT.helpText:
Please indicate in the box below the type of objective test question you want to create.

For example, you could write:

'select two from four'

AUDT.title: Theory or calculation based
AUDT.helpText: Please choose the balance of calculation to theory based objective test questions you would like to create.
options: theory based with no numerical requirements
mixture of calculation (numerical) and theory based

AUDT.title: Number of words in scenario
AUDT.helpText:
You can use this option to specify the number of words in the objective test question scenario.  

You might want to create case study style questions where you need a large scenario, or OTQs where you want the information provided to be limited.  If you have no preference, select "any number of".

AUDT.title: Please select the tax year of the existing material you need to update.
AUDT.helpText: Please choose the tax year of the material which you already have, but want to update.

AUDT.title: Please select the tax year you wish to update to.
AUDT.helpText:
Please choose the tax year which you would like to update your material to.

NOTE: After answering this question you will then be asked to input 'original text'. This should be the text that needs to be updated for the new rules. 

You will need to ensure that KaplanGPT is working from an uploaded document. This may be the key point summary for the relevant new Finance Act, or any other document that you have uploaded into KaplanGPT which you wish to use as a summary of the relevant tax update to be applied.

AUDT.title: End of form
AUDT.helpText: This is the last section of the form, once you submit your form, you will be given a link to follow to go to a site where you will find your prompt.

AUDT.title: Are you going to input some original text or the taxonomy?
AUDT.helpText:
You are being asked this question for one of the following reasons:
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from an existing question and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are seeking Real world examples and you need to specify the subject matter to be illustrated by the examples.
- You are creating written material (text) from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new material.

You have 2 options for the subject matter on which to base your prompt:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options.

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "original text" option and type in your desired subject matter.

BENV.title: Are you going to input some original text or the taxonomy?
BENV.helpText:
You are being asked this question for one of the following reasons:
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from an existing question and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are seeking Real world examples and you need to specify the subject matter to be illustrated by the examples.
- You are creating written material (text) from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new material.

You have 2 options for the subject matter on which to base your prompt:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options.

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "original text" option and type in your desired subject matter.

Do you want to use a taxonomy for the subject matter,  something custom or an existing document upload?
DAIF.helpText:
You have 3 options for the subject matter on which to base your video script:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options. 

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "custom" option and type in your desired subject matter.

3/ Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

DAIF.title: Do you want to use a taxonomy for this subject,  something custom or an existing document upload?
Are you going to input some original text or use an existing document upload?
DAIF.helpText:
You can use the "original text" option in order to submit the existing question and answer on which to base the new question(s) you're creating.

Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

DAIF.title: Would you like to use all the uploaded document, or just part?
Which part?
DAIF.helpText:
Please identify the specific part of the uploaded document which you wish to use. (avoid using page numbers) Examples:

- Test your understanding 2
- Illustration 9
- Question 33 and Answer 33
- Chapter 12 Deferred taxation
- Chapter 11 Hedge accounting, S4.2 Criteria for hedge accounting

DAIF.title: Number of questions
DAIF.helpText:
Please indicate the number of OT questions you would like to create.  As a general rule, it is better to ask for more than you need.  For example, if you want ten good questions, ask for fifteen and filter out the ones you are not as happy with.

This can be written or numerical, i.e. 10 or ten.

PCTN.title: Would you like to reference British Values as part of your prompt?
Do you want to use a taxonomy for the subject matter,  something custom or an existing document upload?
PCTN.helpText:
You have 3 options for the subject matter on which to base your video script:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options. 

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "custom" option and type in your desired subject matter.

3/ Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

PCTN.title: Do you want to use a taxonomy for this subject,  something custom or an existing document upload?
Are you going to input some original text or use an existing document upload?
PCTN.helpText:
You can use the "original text" option in order to submit the existing question and answer on which to base the new question(s) you're creating.

Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

PCTN.title: Subject matter
PCTN.helpText:
You should input the subject matter for your prompt by answering the question below.

Note: If you are "doing your own thing" rather than following a specific prompt, please type your desired prompt here.

PCTN.title: Would you like to use all the uploaded document, or just part?
Which part?
PCTN.helpText:
Please identify the specific part of the uploaded document which you wish to use. (avoid using page numbers) Examples:

- Test your understanding 2
- Illustration 9
- Question 33 and Answer 33
- Chapter 12 Deferred taxation
- Chapter 11 Hedge accounting, S4.2 Criteria for hedge accounting

PCTN.title: Number of questions
PCTN.helpText:
Please indicate the number of OT questions you would like to create.  As a general rule, it is better to ask for more than you need.  For example, if you want ten good questions, ask for fifteen and filter out the ones you are not as happy with.

This can be written or numerical, i.e. 10 or ten.

PCTN.title: KSBs / British values / Functional skills
PCTN.helpText: Here you can decide which, if any, of the KSBs / British values / Functional skills you want to have referenced in the feedback to the OTQs you are creating.

PCTN.title: Which of the following would you like to include (select all that apply - or none)
What type of question do you want to create?
PCTN.helpText: Please choose the type of objective test question you would like to create. If you do not see your question type listed in the options, you can choose "other question type" and be guided to then input the type of question you want to create.

PCTN.title: Fill in the gaps
PCTN.helpText: How many gaps would you like to be included in your 'fill in the gaps' style question?

PCTN.title: How many gaps?
Other question type
PCTN.helpText:
Please indicate in the box below the type of objective test question you want to create.

For example, you could write:

'select two from four'

PCTN.title: Theory or calculation based
PCTN.helpText: Please choose the balance of calculation to theory based objective test questions you would like to create.
options: theory based with no numerical requirements
mixture of calculation (numerical) and theory based

conditionalLogic.option: theory based with no numerical requirements
mixture of calculation (numerical) and theory based

PCTN.title: Number of words in scenario
PCTN.helpText:
You can use this option to specify the number of words in the objective test question scenario.  

You might want to create case study style questions where you need a large scenario, or OTQs where you want the information provided to be limited.  If you have no preference, select "any number of".

PCTN.title: Please select the tax year of the existing material you need to update.
PCTN.helpText: Please choose the tax year of the material which you already have, but want to update.

PCTN.title: Please select the tax year you wish to update to.
PCTN.helpText:
Please choose the tax year which you would like to update your material to.

NOTE: After answering this question you will then be asked to input 'original text'. This should be the text that needs to be updated for the new rules. 

You will need to ensure that KaplanGPT is working from an uploaded document. This may be the key point summary for the relevant new Finance Act, or any other document that you have uploaded into KaplanGPT which you wish to use as a summary of the relevant tax update to be applied.

PCTN.title: End of form
PCTN.helpText: This is the last section of the form, once you submit your form, you will be given a link to follow to go to a site where you will find your prompt.

PCTN.title: Are you going to input some original text or the taxonomy?
PCTN.helpText:
You are being asked this question for one of the following reasons:
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from an existing question and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are seeking Real world examples and you need to specify the subject matter to be illustrated by the examples.
- You are creating written material (text) from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new material.

You have 2 options for the subject matter on which to base your prompt:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options.

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "original text" option and type in your desired subject matter.

INAC.title: Would you like to reference British Values as part of your prompt?
Do you want to use a taxonomy for the subject matter,  something custom or an existing document upload?
INAC.helpText:
You have 3 options for the subject matter on which to base your video script:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options. 

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "custom" option and type in your desired subject matter.

3/ Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

INAC.title: Do you want to use a taxonomy for this subject,  something custom or an existing document upload?
Are you going to input some original text or use an existing document upload?
INAC.helpText:
You can use the "original text" option in order to submit the existing question and answer on which to base the new question(s) you're creating.

Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

INAC.title: Subject matter
INAC.helpText:
You should input the subject matter for your prompt by answering the question below.

Note: If you are "doing your own thing" rather than following a specific prompt, please type your desired prompt here.

INAC.title: Would you like to use all the uploaded document, or just part?
Which part?
INAC.helpText:
Please identify the specific part of the uploaded document which you wish to use. (avoid using page numbers) Examples:

- Test your understanding 2
- Illustration 9
- Question 33 and Answer 33
- Chapter 12 Deferred taxation
- Chapter 11 Hedge accounting, S4.2 Criteria for hedge accounting

INAC.title: Number of questions
INAC.helpText:
Please indicate the number of OT questions you would like to create.  As a general rule, it is better to ask for more than you need.  For example, if you want ten good questions, ask for fifteen and filter out the ones you are not as happy with.

This can be written or numerical, i.e. 10 or ten.

INAC.title: KSBs / British values / Functional skills
INAC.helpText: Here you can decide which, if any, of the KSBs / British values / Functional skills you want to have referenced in the feedback to the OTQs you are creating.

INAC.title: Which of the following would you like to include (select all that apply - or none)
What type of question do you want to create?
INAC.helpText: Please choose the type of objective test question you would like to create. If you do not see your question type listed in the options, you can choose "other question type" and be guided to then input the type of question you want to create.

INAC.title: Fill in the gaps
INAC.helpText: How many gaps would you like to be included in your 'fill in the gaps' style question?

INAC.title: How many gaps?
Other question type
INAC.helpText:
Please indicate in the box below the type of objective test question you want to create.

For example, you could write:

'select two from four'

INAC.title: Theory or calculation based
INAC.helpText: Please choose the balance of calculation to theory based objective test questions you would like to create.
options: theory based with no numerical requirements
mixture of calculation (numerical) and theory based

conditionalLogic.option: theory based with no numerical requirements
mixture of calculation (numerical) and theory based

INAC.title: Number of words in scenario
INAC.helpText:
You can use this option to specify the number of words in the objective test question scenario.  

You might want to create case study style questions where you need a large scenario, or OTQs where you want the information provided to be limited.  If you have no preference, select "any number of".

INAC.title: Please select the tax year of the existing material you need to update.
INAC.helpText: Please choose the tax year of the material which you already have, but want to update.

INAC.title: Please select the tax year you wish to update to.
INAC.helpText:
Please choose the tax year which you would like to update your material to.

NOTE: After answering this question you will then be asked to input 'original text'. This should be the text that needs to be updated for the new rules. 

You will need to ensure that KaplanGPT is working from an uploaded document. This may be the key point summary for the relevant new Finance Act, or any other document that you have uploaded into KaplanGPT which you wish to use as a summary of the relevant tax update to be applied.

INAC.title: End of form
INAC.helpText: This is the last section of the form, once you submit your form, you will be given a link to follow to go to a site where you will find your prompt.

INAC.title: Are you going to input some original text or the taxonomy?
INAC.helpText:
You are being asked this question for one of the following reasons:
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from an existing question and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are seeking Real world examples and you need to specify the subject matter to be illustrated by the examples.
- You are creating written material (text) from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new material.

You have 2 options for the subject matter on which to base your prompt:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options.

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "original text" option and type in your desired subject matter.

FAPS.title: Would you like to reference British Values as part of your prompt?
Do you want to use a taxonomy for the subject matter,  something custom or an existing document upload?
FAPS.helpText:
You have 3 options for the subject matter on which to base your video script:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options. 

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "custom" option and type in your desired subject matter.

3/ Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

FAPS.title: Do you want to use a taxonomy for this subject,  something custom or an existing document upload?
Are you going to input some original text or use an existing document upload?
FAPS.helpText:
You can use the "original text" option in order to submit the existing question and answer on which to base the new question(s) you're creating.

Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

FAPS.title: Subject matter
FAPS.helpText:
You should input the subject matter for your prompt by answering the question below.

Note: If you are "doing your own thing" rather than following a specific prompt, please type your desired prompt here.

FAPS.title: Would you like to use all the uploaded document, or just part?
Which part?
FAPS.helpText:
Please identify the specific part of the uploaded document which you wish to use. (avoid using page numbers) Examples:

- Test your understanding 2
- Illustration 9
- Question 33 and Answer 33
- Chapter 12 Deferred taxation
- Chapter 11 Hedge accounting, S4.2 Criteria for hedge accounting

FAPS.title: Number of questions
FAPS.helpText:
Please indicate the number of OT questions you would like to create.  As a general rule, it is better to ask for more than you need.  For example, if you want ten good questions, ask for fifteen and filter out the ones you are not as happy with.

This can be written or numerical, i.e. 10 or ten.

FAPS.title: KSBs / British values / Functional skills
FAPS.helpText: Here you can decide which, if any, of the KSBs / British values / Functional skills you want to have referenced in the feedback to the OTQs you are creating.

FAPS.title: Which of the following would you like to include (select all that apply - or none)
What type of question do you want to create?
FAPS.helpText: Please choose the type of objective test question you would like to create. If you do not see your question type listed in the options, you can choose "other question type" and be guided to then input the type of question you want to create.

FAPS.title: Fill in the gaps
FAPS.helpText: How many gaps would you like to be included in your 'fill in the gaps' style question?

FAPS.title: How many gaps?
Other question type
FAPS.helpText:
Please indicate in the box below the type of objective test question you want to create.

For example, you could write:

'select two from four'

FAPS.title: Theory or calculation based
FAPS.helpText: Please choose the balance of calculation to theory based objective test questions you would like to create.
options: theory based with no numerical requirements
mixture of calculation (numerical) and theory based

conditionalLogic.option: theory based with no numerical requirements
mixture of calculation (numerical) and theory based

FAPS.title: Number of words in scenario
FAPS.helpText:
You can use this option to specify the number of words in the objective test question scenario.  

You might want to create case study style questions where you need a large scenario, or OTQs where you want the information provided to be limited.  If you have no preference, select "any number of".

FAPS.title: Please select the tax year of the existing material you need to update.
FAPS.helpText: Please choose the tax year of the material which you already have, but want to update.

FAPS.title: Please select the tax year you wish to update to.
FAPS.helpText:
Please choose the tax year which you would like to update your material to.

NOTE: After answering this question you will then be asked to input 'original text'. This should be the text that needs to be updated for the new rules. 

You will need to ensure that KaplanGPT is working from an uploaded document. This may be the key point summary for the relevant new Finance Act, or any other document that you have uploaded into KaplanGPT which you wish to use as a summary of the relevant tax update to be applied.

FAPS.title: End of form
FAPS.helpText: This is the last section of the form, once you submit your form, you will be given a link to follow to go to a site where you will find your prompt.

FAPS.title: Are you going to input some original text or the taxonomy?
FAPS.helpText:
You are being asked this question for one of the following reasons:
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from an existing question and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are seeking Real world examples and you need to specify the subject matter to be illustrated by the examples.
- You are creating written material (text) from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new material.

You have 2 options for the subject matter on which to base your prompt:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options.

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "original text" option and type in your desired subject matter.

TPFB.title: Would you like to reference British Values as part of your prompt?
Do you want to use a taxonomy for the subject matter,  something custom or an existing document upload?
TPFB.helpText:
You have 3 options for the subject matter on which to base your video script:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options. 

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "custom" option and type in your desired subject matter.

3/ Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

TPFB.title: Do you want to use a taxonomy for this subject,  something custom or an existing document upload?
Are you going to input some original text or use an existing document upload?
TPFB.helpText:
You can use the "original text" option in order to submit the existing question and answer on which to base the new question(s) you're creating.

Alternatively, you may wish to use part or all of an existing document (such as an IWB). These documents can be uploaded into Azure. In this instance, select 'Existing document upload'.

TPFB.title: Subject matter
TPFB.helpText:
You should input the subject matter for your prompt by answering the question below.

Note: If you are "doing your own thing" rather than following a specific prompt, please type your desired prompt here.

TPFB.title: Would you like to use all the uploaded document, or just part?
Which part?
TPFB.helpText:
Please identify the specific part of the uploaded document which you wish to use. (avoid using page numbers) Examples:

- Test your understanding 2
- Illustration 9
- Question 33 and Answer 33
- Chapter 12 Deferred taxation
- Chapter 11 Hedge accounting, S4.2 Criteria for hedge accounting

TPFB.title: Number of questions
TPFB.helpText:
Please indicate the number of OT questions you would like to create.  As a general rule, it is better to ask for more than you need.  For example, if you want ten good questions, ask for fifteen and filter out the ones you are not as happy with.

This can be written or numerical, i.e. 10 or ten.

TPFB.title: KSBs / British values / Functional skills
TPFB.helpText: Here you can decide which, if any, of the KSBs / British values / Functional skills you want to have referenced in the feedback to the OTQs you are creating.

TPFB.title: Which of the following would you like to include (select all that apply - or none)
What type of question do you want to create?
TPFB.helpText: Please choose the type of objective test question you would like to create. If you do not see your question type listed in the options, you can choose "other question type" and be guided to then input the type of question you want to create.

TPFB.title: Fill in the gaps
TPFB.helpText: How many gaps would you like to be included in your 'fill in the gaps' style question?

TPFB.title: How many gaps?
Other question type
TPFB.helpText:
Please indicate in the box below the type of objective test question you want to create.

For example, you could write:

'select two from four'

TPFB.title: Theory or calculation based
TPFB.helpText: Please choose the balance of calculation to theory based objective test questions you would like to create.
options: theory based with no numerical requirements
mixture of calculation (numerical) and theory based

conditionalLogic.option: theory based with no numerical requirements
mixture of calculation (numerical) and theory based

TPFB.title: Number of words in scenario
TPFB.helpText:
You can use this option to specify the number of words in the objective test question scenario.  

You might want to create case study style questions where you need a large scenario, or OTQs where you want the information provided to be limited.  If you have no preference, select "any number of".

TPFB.title: Please select the tax year of the existing material you need to update.
TPFB.helpText: Please choose the tax year of the material which you already have, but want to update.

TPFB.title: Please select the tax year you wish to update to.
TPFB.helpText:
Please choose the tax year which you would like to update your material to.

NOTE: After answering this question you will then be asked to input 'original text'. This should be the text that needs to be updated for the new rules. 

You will need to ensure that KaplanGPT is working from an uploaded document. This may be the key point summary for the relevant new Finance Act, or any other document that you have uploaded into KaplanGPT which you wish to use as a summary of the relevant tax update to be applied.

TPFB.title: End of form
TPFB.helpText: This is the last section of the form, once you submit your form, you will be given a link to follow to go to a site where you will find your prompt.

TPFB.title: Are you going to input some original text or the taxonomy?
TPFB.helpText:
You are being asked this question for one of the following reasons:
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from an existing question and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are producing an OTQ or WTQ from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new question.
- You are seeking Real world examples and you need to specify the subject matter to be illustrated by the examples.
- You are creating written material (text) from scratch and you need to specify the subject matter for your new material.

You have 2 options for the subject matter on which to base your prompt:

1/ For specific syllabus outcomes, please select the "taxonomy" option.  These taxonomies are unique to your paper and will allow you to test key syllabus areas and ensure syllabus coverage.  You can "wide-ranging by only selecting L1 or L2, or if you want to drill down into a specific area of the syllabus, you can go all the way to L4 options.

2/ If you want to specify the subject matter yourself, then you can use the "original text" option and type in your desired subject matter.
